_meanings:
{@--1@} Religion
the customary observances of a caste
sect, &c.

{@--2@} Law, usage, practice
custom, ordinance, statute.

{@--12@} Good
company, associating with the 
virtuous.
{@--17@} <ab>N.</ab> of Yama, the god of death.

({%<ab>m.</ab>%} <ab>du.</ab>) right and wrong, 
religion and irreligion.

{%<ab>m.</ab>%} a
Mīmāṃsaka who knows the right
and wrong course of action.

a judge,
magistrate, any judicial functionary.

acting
according to religion, virtuous or
moral conduct.

deviating from virtue, wicked, 
immoral, irreligious.

a 
sacred or penance grove, a wood 
inhabited by ascetics; {#DarmAraRyaM#} 
{#praviSati gajaH#} <ls>Ś. 1. 33.</ls>

{2} justly, 
according to justice or right.

{2} a teacher of law or 
customs.

(with Jainas) the 
category or predicament of virtue; <ab>cf.</ab>
{#astikAya#}.

‘rich in virtue’,
chiefly characterized by justice, 
eminently just and impartial; {#DarmottaraM#}
{#maDyamamASrayaMte#} <ls>R. 13. 7.</ls>

{1} any act of duty or religion,
any moral or religious observance,
a religious act or rite.

a grant, royal edict
or decree.

the collective body of laws or 
duties; {#Darmakozasya guptaye#} <ls>Ms. 1. 99.</ls>

any act of religion,
any moral or religious rite.

{2} <ab>N.</ab> of a plain near
Delhi, the scene of the great battle
between the Kauravas and 
Pāṇḍavas; {#Darmakzetre kurukzetre samavetA yuyutsavaH#}
<ls>Bg. 1. 1.</ls>

a jar of fragrant
water offered daily (to a 
Brāhmaṇa) in the month of Vaiśākha.

observance
of the law, performance of 
religious duties; <ls>Ku. 7. 83.</ls>

practising virtue, observing the law,
virtuous, righteous; <ls>R. 3. 45.</ls>

study of
virtue, consideration, of moral
duties, moral reflection.

one who acts according
to the rules of his caste or 
fulfils prescribed duties.

a
Brāhmaṇa who maintains himself
by assisting other men in the 
performance of their religious rites.

{1} knowing what is right,
conversant with civil or religious
law; <ls>Ms. 7. 141</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">8. 179</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">10. 127.</ls>

a charitable gift (made
without any self-interest.)

a
cow milked for religious purposes
only.

the way of
virtue, a virtuous course of conduct.

a teacher of 
civil or religious law.

‘protector of the law,’ said 
metaphorically of ({#daMqa#}) ‘punishment or 
chastisement,’ or ‘sword’.

transgressing the law, an offence
against law.

{1} a lawful son, a
son begotten from a sense of duty
and not from mere lust or sensual
pleasure. 
{2} an epithet of {#yuDizWira#}.
{3} any one regarded as a son for
religious purposes, a spiritual son.

{1} an expounder of the
law, a legal adviser.

{1} one who tries to make 
profit out of his virtue like a 
merchant.

{2} one who performs religious
rites with a view to reward, like a
merchant dealing in transactions
for profit.

{1} a lawful sister.
{2} a daughter of the spiritual 
preceptor. 
{3} a spiritual sister, any one
regarded as a sister from 
discharging the same religious duties.

a
lecturer or public reader who reads
and explains to audiences sacred
books like the Bhārata, Bhāgavata, 

&c.

{1} ‘a 
preserver or defender of justice,’ a king.

{1} a
fellow religious student, a spiritual
brother.

{2} any one regarded as a
brother from discharging the same
religious duties.

a 
minister of religion, a minister in
charge of religious affairs.

the
foundation of civil or religious law,
the Vedas.

‘delighting in virtue or justice’, 
righteous, pious, just; <ls>R. 1. 23.</ls>

discussion about law or
duty, religious controversy.

{2} a buffalo (being
the vehicle of Yama).
familiar with the law (civil or religious).
knowledge of the law or right.

one who gives away money 
unlawfully acquired in the hope of 
appearing generous.

a code of laws (especially
compiled by sages like Manu, 
Yājṇavalkya, &c.).

a partner or
companion in the discharge of 
religious duties.
